file_content.text: Kind of nice out here, actually.
As soon as Captain Tolto has that report, he can decide what to do out here.
Why are you blocking this road, soldier?
A guard post in the jungle? Keeping something out or in?
Out, my lord.
What's this? Shaking down travelers?
Heh. What are you going to do if we say "yes"?
Hello, gentlemen. Kind of an unusual place for a guard post, yes?
Yes, sir. That, it is.
When the speeders were pulled off the line, people started braving the deeper jungle--trying to make it to Kaas City on foot.
Had a few deaths. Some of them VIPs. Captain Tolto sent us to keep people out and poke around a bit, see what's out there.
It's nice to see the Empire protecting its citizens.
A good idea.
Yeah, some assignments are definitely better than others.
So, tell me already.
If someone is stupid enough to wander the jungles, they deserve what they get.
Pathetic. Let the people die.
As you say, my lord, of course. But we follow the orders we get.
As you say, sir. Orders, though, you know?
We managed to take some data readings, even some holos. Big, nasty critters out there. Nothing to mess with.
Our runner, unfortunately, is down a leg from the experience. If you're headed back towards the spaceport, could you give the observation discs to Captain Tolto?
I can and will. Keep up the good work, men.
Of course.
Thank you.
I get credits for my time.
Ah, of course. I'm sure we can work something out. You'll get your credits.
Sure, why not?
Appreciated. The sooner he knows what's going on, the sooner we can warn people.
Not a chance. [Refuse quest]
Understood. There'll be another runner sent out eventually, I'm sure.
The path is closed by order of the Dark Council.
